title: Drawing, "Sketch for Three Side Wings with Part of Proscenium Frame", Early 18th century
medium: Pen and black ink, graphite on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: A fluted Gothic column upon a pedestal, has at left and at right parts of the stage frame.  Right side wing is below left parts of stage frame, depicting a vase upon a pedestal.  Left side wing is below right stage frame, showing a seated figure. An actor in the fantastic attire of a warrior is represented at left, standing on the floor line. On left: Piedi 18 – altezza del Tellaio; and: Piedi 4 largo. At ends of the column is written: A  B; upper right: A B altezza dell Elissi al Palco / Scenario Piedi 28. Width at column is possibly indicated. At left center, sketch of a left side wing, part of building with door.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketch for Three Side Wings with Part of Proscenium Frame", Early 18th century.
Early 18th century. Pen and black ink, graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-466.
